glsa.title: udisks: Arbitrary code execution
glsa.synopsis: A stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability has been found in udisks, allowing a local attacker to possibly execute arbitrary code or cause Denial of Service.

background.p: udisks is an abstraction for enumerating block devices and performing operations on them.

description.p: A stack-based buffer overflow can be triggered when udisks is given a long path name as a mount point.

impact.p: A local attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or cause a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
